Work Experience

Applications Programmer, University of California Riverside Brain Game Center
Riverside, CA — August 2017 - Present
  • Created a submodule used across all game repositories that contains generic tools, generic scripts, and core game functionality to prevent previous issue of out of sync code across multiple repositories
  • Developed HIPAA compliant serverless architecture with AWS to be used by multiple organizations for managing users, storing logs, producing analytics, delivering configurations, automatically assigning users to configurations, and uploading assets to applications to reduce initial download size
  • To reduce miscommunication between researchers and programmers, implemented configuration driven games that researchers could easily modify without a programmer’s help
Information Technology Research Center Co-op, BMW
Greenville, SC — April 2016 - September 2016
  • Administrator for ELK stack and cluster to provide NHTSA data for analysts
  • Merged Hive tables to provide data standardization for analysts to search and find trends
    • Developed multi-threaded algorithm that reduced run time of monthly data pushes from Hive to ELK by several days to free cluster resources
    • Created distributed machine learning algorithm using dataset of engines to classify defects in the factory which outperformed AlexNet by ~35%
  • Developed flexible Python server for delivering fake data to applications to demo the Amazon Echo
  • Developed Oculus VR walkthrough and car demo in Unity to demonstrate VR restraints and possibilities
  • Built eight node Raspberry Pi cluster for training new interns on cluster computing
Programmer, Entrepreneurial Game Studio
Philadelphia, PA — October 2013 - August 2017
  • Programmer for the “World's Largest Architectural Video Game”. Created single and multiplayer Tetris on both sides of the Cira Center building
    • Improved codebase to feature better design principles and faster execution (e.g. built in double buffering)
    • Media coverage included over 1,500 articles and mentions along with an estimated 2.2 billion views
  • Developer for IOS augmented reality game using city buildings as objectives for players to capture as a team using a chat system to communicate. Project was discontinued due to hardware restraints at time of development.
  • Built website to show number of tweets from each country on world map for Dalai Lama visit to Philadelphia
  • Member of Lunar Rabbit Games working on new game, Heartline
R&D Innovations Team Development Co-op, iPipeline
Philadelphia, PA — April 2015 - September 2015
  • Coordinated with outside vendor to implement form tracking and analytics into existing product
  • Developed SMS based systems with Node.js and Twilio
    • Created “Text-a-Quote,” which received basic information from the user and sent back a life insurance quote. This included recommendations for the user to remedy errors encountered
    • Lead Developer of “Pipe-SMS,” a one-way texting service designed for iPipeline applications to text users
  • Researched wearable tech for in-house fitness hackathon and developed OAuth service to verify data retrieval from available REST services
